problem.p: Consider air as an ideal gas with [mathjaxinline]C_p = 1000[/mathjaxinline] J/(kg.K), [mathjaxinline]R = 287[/mathjaxinline] J/(kg.K) and [mathjaxinline]\gamma \approx 1.4[/mathjaxinline]. It is compressed from 1 bar, 300K to 10 bar using a compressor. The compressor can be considered adiabatic but not reversible.The flow rate is 2 kg/s, and the entropy production rate is 200 W/K.
Problem 2A. Which figure best represents the process?
Problem 2B. What is the change in specific entropy of the gas (units of J/(kg.K)) as it moves from inlet to exit?
Problem 2C. If the process was reversible apart from being adiabatic, what would have been the final
Temperature (in kelvin) of the gas at the exit?
Problem 2D. What is the actual temperature of the gas at the exit (in kelvin)?
Problem 2E. What is the power consumed by the compressor (in kW)? Do not enter the sign.
Problem 2F. What is the isentropic efficiency of the compressor? Enter the value as a fraction.
